instructions: Image titled Scan a QR Code Step 1 1 Open your iPhone's Camera. Tap the Camera app icon, which resembles a black camera on a grey background. Image titled Scan a QR Code Step 2 2 Point the camera at the QR code. Your phone should focus in on the QR code after a brief moment. If your front-facing camera is on, first tap the camera-shaped icon in the bottom-right corner of the screen to flip the camera to the main camera. Image titled Scan a QR Code Step 3 3 Make sure the QR code is centered on your iPhone's screen. All four edges of the QR code should be on your iPhone's screen. Image titled Scan a QR Code Step 4 4 Wait for the code to scan. Once the QR code is centered on your iPhone's screen, it should scan almost immediately. Image titled Scan a QR Code Step 5 5 Open the QR code's content. Tap the Safari notification that appears at the top of the screen to open the QR code's webpage or other information. Advertisement

Image titled Scan a QR Code Step 6 1 Open your Android's Image titled Androidgoogleplay.png Google Play Store. Tap the Google Play Store app icon, which resembles a multicolored triangle. Image titled Scan a QR Code Step 7 2 Tap the search bar. It's at the top of the screen. Image titled Scan a QR Code Step 8 3 Type in qr code reader no ads . This will prompt a drop-down menu with search results. Image titled Scan a QR Code Step 9 4 Tap . It should be at the top of the drop-down menu. Doing so opens the app's page. Image titled Scan a QR Code Step 10 5 Tap . This button is on the right side of the screen. Image titled Scan a QR Code Step 11 6 Tap . It's in the middle of the pop-up. The QR Code Reader app will begin downloading. Image titled Scan a QR Code Step 12 7 Tap . This button will appear in place of the INSTALL button as soon as the app finishes installing. Tapping it will open QR Code Reader. Image titled Scan a QR Code Step 13 8 Point your Android's camera at the QR code. It will focus on the code after a moment. Image titled Scan a QR Code Step 14 9 Make sure that the QR code is centered in the screen. Your QR code should fit between the four brackets in the middle of your Android's screen. Image titled Scan a QR Code Step 15 10 Wait for the code to scan. Once the code scans, you'll see an image of the QR code on the screen, along with whatever the QR code's content is (e.g., a link) listed below the image. Advertisement
